meanings.definition: In a manner that is not truthful or honest.
meanings.sent1: She spoke untruthfully about her whereabouts.
meanings.sent2: He untruthfully claimed he had finished his homework.
meanings.sent3: The cat untruthfully pretended to be innocent after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds untruthfully promised rain but only brought a light drizzle.
meanings.sent5: The magician untruthfully made the rabbit disappear before our eyes.

meanings.sent1: He untruthfully denied eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: She untruthfully assured her friend that she liked the gift.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel untruthfully claimed it wasn't the one who stole the nuts.
meanings.sent4: The old clock untruthfully chimed midnight when it was only 9 o'clock.
meanings.sent5: The politician untruthfully promised lower taxes to win votes.
